overview_of_class: This class is designed to introduce students to the study of Latina/o Religion. We will be reading and discussing topics from a variety of topics, including disciplines such as religious studies, History, Anthropology, and Sociology. Students will have an opportunity to learn how these different fields approach the topic and how they speak (or don't) with each other. During the quarter, students will have the opportunity to critically examine the connections between religion, ethnic identity, and society.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This class is designed to introduce students to the study of Latina/o Religion. We will be reading and discussing topics from a variety of topics, including disciplines such as religious studies, History, Anthropology, and Sociology. Students will have an opportunity to learn how these different fields approach the topic and how they speak (or don't) with each other. During the quarter, students will have the opportunity to critically examine the connections between religion, ethnic identity, and society.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
the key objectives are:
To introduce students to key concepts in the study of Latina/o Religion.
Challenge misconceptions and stereotypes about the religious make up of Latinas/os in the U.S.
Examine the role that religion plays for Latinas/os in different areas of social life, including politics and social movements, family, health, education.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: at the moment, no books have been selected and the plan is to read articles, all of which will be available via canvas.
